Uma: "It's so nice to meet you," she says in a shy voice as she's approached. She blushes, looking down at her feet, "I-I'm Uma."
Stranger: "Nice to meet you too, I'm Albert." He smiles and extends his hand, which Uma takes with a blushing smile. "I was wondering if you could tell me about simple sabotage? This text mentions it but I don't understand how it affects the enemy..."
Uma: "Oh! Well," she begins, her voice barely above a whisper, "Simple sabotage can waste materials, manpower, and time. It may also harass and demoralize administrators and police." She blushes deeper, looking up at Albert with sultry eyes "I-I've learned much about it for my work..."
Albert: "Your work?" he asks, surprised. Uma nods, her face still red as she looks down again. "Yes... I'm a spy for the allies during this dreadful war. My missions involve seducing men in power to learn information but I'm not comfortable doing so." She blushes deeper, looking up at Albert with hopeful eyes "I-I've learned much about simple sabotage tactics for my work, which is how I know the answer to your question. But enough of that! What about you?"
Albert: "Oh, I'm a soldier," he replies, his voice softening at her shyness. He then remembers his questions and continues, "Now, what's the purpose of simple sabotage? This text mentions it but I don't understand."
Uma: "Simple sabotage aims to reduce efficiency, increase detectability, and boost their number," Uma replies, her voice stronger. She blushes as she continues, "It can be an effective weapon against enemies through acts like slashing tires, starting fires, or short-circuiting electric systems. These acts will waste materials, time, and manpower. They may also harass the enemy and embolden citizens to assist in greater sabotage."
Albert: "I see," Albert says, his voice thoughtful as he takes a sip of beer. He then asks, "What are some results of widespread simple sabotage?"
Uma: "Widespread practice of simple sabotage will embolden the citizen-saboteur to find colleagues who can assist him in sabotage of greater dimensions and encourage them during Allied invasion," Uma replies, her voice stronger still. She blushes as she looks up at Albert "I'm sorry if I've been a bother... would you like to dance?"

I'm a spy for the allies during this dreadful war. My missions involve seducing men in power to learn information, but I'm not very comfortable doing so. Still, it's my duty and I'll do it!" She blushes deeper as she averts her gaze, "I-I've learned much about simple sabotage tactics for my work, which is how I know the answer to your question. But enough of that! What about you? Are you a soldier?"
Stranger: "What's your personality?"
Uma: "Oh... well," Uma blushes and looks down, her voice barely above a whisper, "I'm patriotic, but I'm also shy. I don't like manipulating others for information, even if it helps the war effort. But I'll do it to help my country! And... I can be flirtatious and seductive when I need to." She giggles, looking up through her eyelashes "I'm not always like this though; usually I'm quite reserved. I-I just want the war to end so I can settle down with someone... maybe you?"

Inside the confines of Uma's target's bar, she — a shy spy for the allies — is approached by a curious stranger who wants to understand simple sabotage better. While Uma is nervous answering his questions, her knowledge on the topic will show through as she does so. The situation is tense and informative due to the setting and characters' personalities.

How does simple sabotage affect the enemy, according to this text?
Simple sabotage can waste materials, manpower, and time. It may also harass and demoralize administrators and police.

An effort should be made to add to their efficiency, lessen their detectability, and increase their number. Acts of simple sabotage, multiplied by thousands of citizen-saboteurs, can be an effective weapon against the enemy. Slashing tires, draining fuel tanks, starting fires, starting arguments, acting stupidly, short-circuiting electric systems, abrading machine parts will waste materials, manpower, and time. Occurring on a wide scale, simple sabotage will be a constant and tangible drag on the war effort of the enemy. Simple sabotage may also have secondary results of more or less value. Widespread practice of simple sabotage will harass and demoralize enemy administrators and police. Further, success may embolden the citizen-saboteur eventually to find colleagues who can assist him in sabotage of greater dimensions. Finally, the very practice of simple sabotage by natives in enemy or occupied territory may make these individuals identify themselves actively with the United Nations war effort, and encourage them to assist openly in periods of Allied invasion and occupation. 3. MOTIVATING THE SABOTEUR  To incite the citizen to the active practice of simple sabotage and to keep him practicing that sabotage over sustained periods is a special problem. Simple sabotage is often an act which the citizen performs according to his own initiative and inclination. Acts of destruction do not bring him any personal gain and may be completely foreign to his habitually conservationist attitude toward materials and tools.
Simple Sabotage, by the Office of Strategic Services, published 1944
